DOCNAME: CASE OF RANJBAR AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and currently live in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicants fled GPE and entered GPE illegally on various dates in DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On various dates DATE and DATE , the applicants appeared at the office of the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( “ the ORG ” ) in GPE , which recognised their refugee status and issued them with refugee certificates on DATE .

CARDINAL . On unspecified dates the applicants lodged asylum applications with the NORP authorities and sought residence permits . They were questioned twice by police officers from ORG on various dates in DATE for an assessment of their asylum request . During the questioning the applicants stated that they had been members of different illegal organisations and had been involved in anti - regime activities in GPE . They had either been detained on numerous occasions or sentenced to imprisonment and/or punishment by lashing . They all maintained that they would face a personal risk of ill - treatment or death if they were to be returned to GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants were permitted to live in PERSON pending the asylum proceedings and were allowed to leave the city boundaries subject to specific permission . In this connection one of the applicants ( GPE PERSON ) was issued with a permit allowing him to travel to GPE DATE for various resettlement interviews .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants ' asylum request was rejected by the authorities on the ground that they had not complied with the relevant criteria . In respect of the fourth applicant , the interview forms indicated that the authorities did not find the applicant 's replies credible and considered that he had left his country for higher economic standards .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants were apprehended and held at ORG for an undetermined period before they were notified of the deportation orders on DATE at TIME The deportation orders bear the signatures of the applicants and a translator . The applicants were deported to GPE on DATE .
CARDINAL . Upon their arrival in GPE the applicants claimed to have been held in detention for DATE . They then had lived in LOC for DATE before they were resettled in GPE on DATE .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the ORG 's judgment in the case of GPE and GPE v. GPE ( no . ORG , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
